value.title: Populate a Power BI parameter list using a query
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how to populate a Power BI parameter list using a query. This can help you avoid manually entering a list, or just having free text.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Apps for multiple audiences has arrived!
value.excerpt: This has been a feature that has been asked for long time! The ability to control who can see what content within a published Power BI App! You can now serve up multiple audiences within a single app.  Announcing Public Preview of Multiple Audiences for Power BI Apps https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-public-preview-of-multiple-audiences-for-power-bi-apps/

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/

value.title: Power BI dataflows vs datamarts: What's the difference???
value.excerpt: Are you excited about datamart in Power BI? What about dataflows? Should you even use dataflows anymore? Do we just datamart all the things? Let's have a look!  Introduction to datamarts https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/datamarts/datamarts-overview  Comparing dataflows to datamarts

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model

value.title: What is this delta lake thing?

Connect with Stijn https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  What is Delta Lake https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-what-is-delta-lake

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Power BI From and To Date Filtering with One Slicer
value.excerpt: It happens that you might have two fields as From and To date (or Start and End date) in your dataset, and you want a date slicer in the report. The date slicer has to filter records in a way that the FROM and the TO dates are in the range of dates selected in the slicer. There are multiple ways of doing

value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.excerpt: I have previously written about how to sort a column by another column, and I used Month Names as an example.
